website_summaries.verdict: A mixer that makes your work easy and is a good value for the money.
pros: Instructions and manual are easy to understand
cons: This mixer has a tendency to vibrate at top speeds
This mixer also has a larger footprint than others

customer_reviews.title: Happy with My 1st ever Mixer!
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned a stand up mixer and with the costs of Kitchenaid mixers, I've been hesitant. With the good reviews and better price, I gave it a try. I've made: Challah Bread, Cinnamon Rolls & icing. The dough hook made kneading way easier! Big fan so far, like the suction cups on the bottom. Easy clean up bowl & slippery, non-stick on attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable stand mixer!
customer_reviews.text: This a great standard mixer without breaking the bank. I've made two dozen cookies(beat blade), pizza dough(dough hook), baked French Toast(whisk attachment) and English Muffin bread(dough hook) in two days since delivery! The attachments are dishwasher safe but I prefer to wash by hand and it is a breeze to do so. The suction cups on the bottom keep the machine secure on the counter while in use. It's VERY lightweight and easy to move around. This a good stand mixer for a beginner cook or for simple baking. I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Glad I made this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I waited a long time to buy a stand mixer. I checked out several models . Read tons of reviews. So very happy i went with this Hamilton Beach 63391Stand Mixer. I don't do a lot of baking but when my Black and Decker hand mixer finally died i didn't want to mix homemade cookies and donuts by hand. Perfect for the job. So far worked great for everything from Mixing Meatloaf and pie crust To whipping Cream!! Really like this mixer Thinking of buying one for my daughter and one for my son's girlfriend for next Christmas!!
customer_reviews.author: Judy WIDRICK

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Stand Mixer for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I love this mixer. I had a KitchenAid, and after 20 years, it gave up the ghost. I just didn’t want to pay $400+ dollars for another KitchenAid, and was excited to find the Hamilton Beach for 1/5 the price. It does everything I need a stand mixer to do. It doesn’t have the powered hub, but I never used that feature, even when I had it. So, I don’t miss it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Have to really scrape sides!
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed in how it performed when mixing a cake batter. I bought this because I thought it would make it easier to mix a cake recipe. But, it didn't mix well on the sides of the bowls even after scraping the sides. I guess I will go back to my hand mixer.
customer_reviews.author: M.King

customer_reviews.title: I bough a new item, but it does not look like new.
customer_reviews.text: The product said it is a new item. When I got it. It look like a return item. The cable is loose. Ticker on the bowl likes removed before. No wrapping on the bowl, The attachment attached on the machine. Pro:1.Features just like KitchenAid, but only 1/3 price. I use it less than once a month. 2. easy to use. Con:1. plastic body. 2. easy to pull up the head, but need press the button to push down. 3. Splash guard difficult to install. 4. no options to add other attachments. 5. One last thing, Warranty. For Canada purchase is 5 years, but USA is 1 year. Why? Is goods in USA more easy to break?
customer_reviews.author: HL75206

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mixer!
customer_reviews.text: Who says you need a kitchenaid to be a Baker. This works just fine! I had no problems out of it making this cake and the frosting plus I use Crisco no butter in my icing holds better and this worked like a charm. Much cheaper then the kitchenaid! But like I tell everyone an expensive mixer dont make you a better Baker lol buttons didnt stick, splash guard is awesome. I'll probably get another for my mom
customer_reviews.author: Melissa B.

customer_reviews.title: Can’t handle cookie dough, numbers rubbing off after 6 uses
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this mixer. I didn’t expect a lot because of the price, but I have only used it maybe 6 times and the numbers on the dial are almost completely rubbed off. (I haven’t cleaned it with anything but a wet wash rag) I also can’t even make basic chocolate chip cookie dough without the motor grinding and locking up. It is only good for cake batter, meringue, and whipped cream, in my experience. I am going to try to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Nelson

customer_reviews.title: A great mixer.
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I needed.It is very powerful and lightweight so I can easily move it. I don’t care for the tilt button for lifting the head up as I have sore shoulders and it needs to be tilted with that button. It has good power. The 1st time I used it I started it too fast and had flour all over and into all the parts. That was difficult to get out of all the crevices and it hasn’t happened again by starting on a low setting.
customer_reviews.author: dq chick

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable for the price.
customer_reviews.text: So it's not a fancy mixer with 1000 accessories... BUT, for the other 99% of typical mixer uses, it works like a champ, and is dirt-cheap by comparison. We've used our mixer several times per week since getting it, and it works well/predictably every time.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Has worked great so far!
customer_reviews.text: So this is obviously not the BIG name in stand mixers, but we don't bake or do this kind of thing often. We just had a sudden urge to bake. The day we received this, we baked for about 7 hours, more the next day, and more the next weekend. Granted, I'm talking a short period of time, but we've kind of put this thing through the gauntlet. I'll tell you, for the money, we've been extremely happy w/ our return on investment.
customer_reviews.author: Book Fiend

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Plastic Design
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife for Christmas. First time she used it the mixer broke. After examining the break, I discovered that the tilt is made of two cheap plastic tabs that hinge the top and bottom of the mixer. Ended up returning this product. I don’t think this was defective, it’s a poor design. Cheap plastic used in a high wear spot never ends well.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mixer
customer_reviews.text: Mixes as good as kitchenaid and price is 1/3rd of kitchenaid! I m loving it! Very easy to make dough. Easy to clean. Light weight. I use it to make roti/chapati dough few times a week. Excellent addition to my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: punyatoya

customer_reviews.title: Great first stand mixer!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever stand mixer, I bought it because I want to get more into baking, and so far I love it!! It's SUPER easy to clean, the instructions are so simple to understand, and for a beginner baker like me this is the perfect product!! The noise level is to be expected, it's a mixer, but I love this mixer!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, does the job I need it to do
customer_reviews.text: For $100 this is a great addition to my kitchen. I'm not one to make cakes often, no sweet tooth here, but it's great to have this for making a few cupcakes with my daughter or knowing I can whisk up some cream with ease in the future. It's not too big for me to have a storage issue and has all the paddles I imagine I'll ever need. Glad I got it. Definitely not a high end, super baker/cake maker object of desire but just great for a mom who wants to have some fun in the kitchen with her daughter.
customer_reviews.author: KWD

customer_reviews.title: Nice product. Perfect substitution for a kitchen aid
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. Perfect substitution for a kitchen aid. This is my first stand mixer and works well. I do have to scrape the bowl a few times but at this moment i didn’t need the added features of the kitchen aid so this was the perfect and affordable alternative.
customer_reviews.author: JEN

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't live up to its hype
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mixer because I liked the way it tilted up to remove beaters. That's true! I still do. However, the description also said that the bowl and beaters were made so that you didn't have to scrap stuff down from the side of the bowl. As the picture shows, that's no true. Also when using a small amount of stuff - say to make some cookie icing, it doesn't do a good job mixing it. It does cookie dough fine - mixing that is; but it does not eliminate scraping it off the sides of the bowl. Huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: DUGAL MAC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Light use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for life skills class and it has worked for us for the past 2 months of once a week use. After level 4 it begins to rock from the force of the mixing but not so badly we can’t use. Locking mixing bowl is a nice touch. Easy to use easy to clean. Pushing in the release button and simultaneously lifting the head with one hand is impossible but just use two and it’s fine. I have a 25 year old kitchen aide at home and while this isn’t as sturdy as old faithful, I don’t regret buying it for my classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Smith870

customer_reviews.title: Not happy.
customer_reviews.text: After 6 day waiting, finally i got the mixer machine today, but don't work in the way i was expecting. The whisk don't touch the bottom bowl to do meringue or any cream. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: caro

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer
customer_reviews.text: I loved this mixer. It’s great to mix Cake dough. It’s so easy to use, that my 11 years old son did his firs cake on that thing.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Total Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply built not durable the mixer attachment doesn't stay on, extremely loud, the mixer doesn't turn turn. I attempted to make a cake first time using and it just stops spinning. I had to switch to my hand mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Serenity

customer_reviews.title: LLLOOOVVVEEE
customer_reviews.text: I normally wait and research almost everything before I buy it and I'm glad I did! I've had this for only almost 2 weeks and have already made several cakes!! This mixer is amazing, had little suction cup feet on the bottom that holds nice on my granite countertop! The only drawback is that the cord is too short I'm not sure why they would do that. I added an extension cord and that helped a whole lot. Other than that..I ♥️ it
customer_reviews.author: Aye

customer_reviews.title: A superior mix master!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best thing an elder like me could find.It has a great ability to be easy to do all the things it is intended to do and is light to carry and move around, the lever to move the head up works fantastically,the flour shield is an ease for blending and is just like the kitchen aid I had years ago which is too much for me now.Changing attachments is a breeze and I can easily lift the bowl which I have been struggling doing without this. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Rita Hadeler

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love
customer_reviews.text: So, I am a frugal person and I try not to waste money. If I can get by without a product by using something else, I will. I "splurged" on myself and bought this. I absolutely LOVE this!! I used it today for the first time. I can't wait to use it again! This was easy to use, easy to clean. I can't really speak to durability yet but I'm confident this will be excellent for me. I love to cook and this will be a good companion in my kitchen. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Gwen Fall

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 10 months- embarrassing gift
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk. I gave this to my daughter in law last Christmas. By October it no longer worked. Didn’t even last va year. I was so embarrassed. While making even a simple single batch of cookies, the mixer did not have enough torque to move the mixing blade and it would just skip. I replaced it with a kitchen aid, which I should have bought from the start. I thought the Hamilton Beach name was reputable... not so much
customer_reviews.author: jet snail

customer_reviews.title: I'm a Baker and use a mixer often.
customer_reviews.text: So I got this product on February 24th of 2018 and it is currently February 9th of 2020, basically it lasted me almost exactly two years? One year in the base of the bowl rusted off? I tried to reattach it with some glue but it always just popped back off so I gave up using that portion so don't let the bowl soak in your sink like I did. As of today. The top of the mixer and the bottom have disconnected? I've attempted to reconnect it to no avail. I guess it's fine since it was my first mixer, but I think I'm going to try a different brand this time around.
customer_reviews.author: ayana

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I like it! I wanted a fancy stand mixer that costs $300+ for my birthday but that didn't happen. Lol! So I bought this little mixer for myself. I needed it to make gluten free bread which takes a lot of mixing, too much to do by hand. I was pleantly surprised. It does what I needed it to do. And the price is right. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: NP209

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent mixer for the price ... and ... light weight, which means you can easily put it away if seldom used.
customer_reviews.text: I don't do a lot of baking but when I do and have to mix cookie dough, I find that the small handheld mixer not up to par. I make banana bread and peanut butter cookies and mix in some nut ie: Macadamia and or Walnuts, and I find that a hand mixer is hard to control especially when you mix in the nuts. Like I said, I don't do much baking and I really didn't need one of those expensive mixers with all the whiz-bang attachments ... and very heavy to boot! This was in my price range and so far, I'm impressed on how good it works.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Thiel

customer_reviews.title: Works well but the writing on the knob comes off ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well but the writing on the knob comes off if it gets wet. You do have to stop and scrape down the sides and bottom to ensure it incorporates all the ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Michele E.

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: I use this a lot. It does the job. There is some noise, but it's not too bad, although I can't really hear the radio if I'm playing it while using the machine. It is pretty easy to clean and store. The only caveat is that the blades don't go completely to the bottom of the bowl (I don't know if any do, because then the blades might not be able to move properly) so I sometimes turn off the machine and scrape the bottom of the bowl to bring up those ingredients. However, I have been able to beat egg whites until they're stiff without leaving any unbeaten egg on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: D. G.

customer_reviews.title: This does the work of the pricey mixers for a lot less money! WIN!
customer_reviews.text: Not all of us can afford an expensive mixer, the great news is that you don't need one... this machine does an excellent job! I've made cookies, cakes, cheese, butter and yes, even bread with this mixer! Never disappointed, it works great! My only concern in the beginning was the machine shakes a bit at high speeds, but didn't "dance" around. The suction cups on the bottom kept it firmly placed! I love the attachments! The splash guard is a nice addition! It's also pretty and looks good on my counter! I love it and for the price, you can't beat it!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kermeen

customer_reviews.title: A great find.
customer_reviews.text: Love this mixer. I wanted a light weight mixer, but I wanted one that would be easy to store when not in use, but one that performed. I was not disappointed. My only downside issue is there is not much space to add ingredients while the mixer is in use. I found when you need to add ingredients, best to stop machine, lift the top, and then add and put the top back and resume. It’s not that big of an issue,as the machine does a great job, but just wanted to mention.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Lerch

customer_reviews.title: Can’t knead dough
customer_reviews.text: Bought specifically for bread and it can’t handle kneading. The thing over heats and shakes. It can’t reach the bottom of the bowl to get all the dough. Takes me 10 minutes to knead the bread to the right consistency, the dough has been in there for 25 and still isn’t right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I just couldn't spend the money for the best one and I'm glad I didn't. This works great for my needs. Easy to use, easy to clean. Everything goes in the dishwasher. The only issue I have found is with the plastic spatter attachment. The pouring opening does not extend out far enough to catch everything going into the mixing bowl and the main arm of the mixer has to be in a half up position to put this attachment on and off. But it's not a deal breaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jeaniem

customer_reviews.title: Have had issue with 2 machines
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased this mixer in December. After a few uses I started having trouble with the button that lifts the mixing head up and down. I was able to return it and get a new model. Unfortunately the problem is now happening again with the new machine. Very very disappointed. Apart from this issue I liked the mixer but I would NOT buy this model again. Will have to look elsewhere for a decent stand mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: First off, whomever shipped this to us. Sold us a USED unit and the box was so dinged up was shocked nothing was broken. Was gonna return it because of that, but do like the mixer and did not wanna go through the hassle of returning it. That is the reason for the 2 star. We do like the unit even though the splash guard is useless. I mean get what you pay for I guess. So try a different seller if wanting to buy this product for sure. Horrible
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Ronk

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a good price
customer_reviews.text: easy to operate, well worth the money, good quality mixer. I researched carefully and read other reviews. The reviewer that said adding ingredients was difficult to thje mixer when using it was wrong, it's easy, the splatter guard critic must not have used it properly or at all, and the one that said it shook when used at high speeds did not get one like I did. I love it and rgink that it is better than the more expensive kitchen aid.
customer_reviews.author: arthur guice

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I had shoulder surgery and could no longer stir heavy dough or meatloaf mix. This does the trick at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Flaningan

customer_reviews.title: broke fast
customer_reviews.text: I have used this about 6 times. Each time, using 2 cups of flower. This time, I used 4 cups, which it has more than enough capacity for and the mixer park broke. It was too much for it and now it doesn't spin. Very disappointing-waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Easy Use and Cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Not too Shabby.... Lightweight, Easy to use, Easy to Clean, durable construction. Unless you need an actual commercial mixer, this is the way to go. It does the same job as a commercial mixer, but just on a smaller scale.
customer_reviews.author: Jackal61

customer_reviews.title: Received a Used mixer
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this mixer. When I opened the box and pulled it out, it was quite evident that it was used. Had finger prints and smudge marks and and scratches all over it. Sent it back the next day. Went to Sam’s club and bought a Kitchen Aid bowl lift mixer. That’s going back too. It is the most awkward mixer to work with. I made a cake that called to be mixed by hand. So I used it to make the Icing and it all clumped up in the beater. I had to finish it up with my hand mixer that worked way better than the $238.00 Kitchen Aid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach Steps Up Again
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mixer for the home baker. I was using an electric hand mixer for years to make cookies. It just got to hard. I did not need a big $300 mixer. This one is just the right size for me. Easy to store and light weight. You do need to use the shield that comes with it. I have a Hamilton Beach toaster oven & Hamilton Beach iron that I have had for years. I love them both. Hamilton Beach comes out with great features you would find in more expensive products. They last for years with no problems. When looking for a product I always go with them.
customer_reviews.author: Caryn Gussin

customer_reviews.title: It’s not a Kitchenaid
customer_reviews.text: It does the basic job but not superior. Having hand trouble I thought this would make cooking easier. It does not do well with small amounts and sometimes ingredients on the bottom are not mixed in. Easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: SandiW

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a review of this after I used it for the first time. I have other Hamilton Beach small appliances and like them. I think this is a good product. Never had a stand mixer, so can't compare it to others. I do think it works as well as a more expensive model. it is easy to use, and all the parts wash up very easily. I do like this product. I've used it now a lot, love it. A great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Deininger

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is nice and lightweight but that is where the pros stop. It is noisy, almost sounds broken right out of the box. I tried to make dough in it about five minutes after opening it and ended up having to mix it by hand. I’ll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: best mixer I've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: look at all brands and models, this is the best. 1. it is extremely easy to clean, as if it cleans itself 2. it is small, smaller than a coffee maker 3. it is quite 4. great price I highly recommend this mixer
customer_reviews.author: mehrdad m.

customer_reviews.title: OK mixer if you don't expect much.
customer_reviews.text: Not a quality mixer. Plastic everywhere. Dust/splash shield did nothing to prevent dust from escaping. Thick batters shook the mixer so much that you had to hold on to it from moving.
customer_reviews.author: D''s

customer_reviews.title: Limited power and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Now I know why the other one is a lot more expensive. There is a limit to how much and how fast you can do. However, it's great for what I use for me. This product is good for occasional use. Otherwise, you need a heavier one.
customer_reviews.author: therabbitnews

customer_reviews.title: Ligh weight Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Good product, except the "whipper" attachment broke (loss a wire) after a few uses. Othe than this problem, I would highly recommend this mixer. I like that it is light enough tht I can move it myself and it does a great job in preperation of foods. I would love to get a replacemen for the "whipper" attachment, but have not had any luck. If this did not break, I would give it 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent mixer
customer_reviews.text: I had an older model Hamilton Beach mixer where the mixer lifted up and could be used as a hand held. I purchased this one because it resembled a $300 Kitchen Aide model so I thought it was an upgrade. Initially, I was upset at the mixing performance. However, I just needed to get used to it. By the third try, we were friends.
customer_reviews.author: Malaika

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this one. I had a hand mixer but wanted to make meringue and the hand-mixer was not very comfortable. So I ordered this. It is very affordable. I used this for cake mix, swiss meringue buttercream(came out amazing), chapathi dough mix. Everything was good. Such a great product for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Sai

customer_reviews.title: Quality Stand Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Works quite well. Does almost everything that more expensive ones do. Have made dozens of batches of bread and other baked goods during this pandemic time. Everything comes out with much higher consistency. I also saved loads of time and effort as the mixer does what I used to do by hand. Best mixer out there at this price range.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: This mixer has worked very well over the past month. The mixer's high speed effectively beat egg whites and whipped cream. The different speeds were very handy when making cheesecake when different speeds were needed for different ingredients. It was difficult to figure out how to sift flour into the bowl, but eventually we just did the adding in a few extra steps. The suction cups on the bottom of the mixer keep it firmly in place and the mixer mixed everything thoroughly. One still needs to stop and scrape down the sides of the bowl, but I think that happens with all mixers.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Wiczer

customer_reviews.title: It's cool. Just needs to be more sturdy when ok speed 7.
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Honestly I had the older model and that I must say was a more sturdy one. When this mixes on speed 7 it wobbles side to side like its gonna topple over I think it's because the material made it like a light fiber glass material. It's ok. Had to order it because I needed one fast. And I liked the the paddle was metal. Its can get the job done then.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am impressed
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed by this product. I know that it is not as good as my Kitchen Aid mixer, but for the price it is a good buy
customer_reviews.author: Lars

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy use...
customer_reviews.text: 2 stars because it is very lightweight. Has suction cups to hold in place. Tilt head popped up while mixing cookie dough. Would have been a disaster if it had been mixing liquids.
customer_reviews.author: Terrie

customer_reviews.title: Great compact mixer at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful compact mixer where all the attachments fit into the bowl for storage. The top handle locks in place and you can easily carry it. The mixer itself works well and is adequate for cooking for 2. It replaced a 5 quart Kitchenaid, obviously not as heavy duty but for 1/3 the price, its a steal! Very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: CentralCoastGal

customer_reviews.title: Three Cups of Flour Was Too Much.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible mixer. With three cups of flour it shakes violently on speed for which says it's for mixing. Unable to handle any capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Predj

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: While it is an easy to use stand mixer. Hamilton Beach, has managed to drop the ball on a product that would have otherwise been able to change the meaning of the word, stand mixer, from KitchenAid, to "there is a more affordable choice that is just as good." It is nice to look at, but that may be all there is to it. It does not stand the test of making something as simple as chocolate chip cookies.
customer_reviews.author: Michali R.

customer_reviews.title: Voltage requirement, please check first prior purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Missing information, i live in a country with 240 v 50h electricty supply, i didnt know this product is for 120v only, so disappointed when it arrived and seen the machine, even the product leaflet doesnt have the electricity information. I need to find a voltage regulator , for the ,meantime, its off to the storage...
customer_reviews.author: Jc

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t use it yet but I always have a great experience with Hamilton Beach kitchen supplies I have coffee maker and food proceeded Easy use great value and great quality I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: F Soltani

customer_reviews.title: takes to long
customer_reviews.text: when mixing the dough in the unit I could have made three portions of the same size dough. Also the machine was loud and shook violently while mixing.
customer_reviews.author: Wally B.

customer_reviews.title: Love this Mixer
customer_reviews.text: I have bursitis in my shoulder so hand mixing is out. I got this as a gift and I love it. It is light weight, easy to use and comes with three attachments. I made loads of Christmas cookies this year with it. I got the blue one and the cover for it.
customer_reviews.author: GeriK

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!!
customer_reviews.text: This has to be one of the least durable kitchen machines I have ever owned. My third time using it, after just a month of ownership, the plastic stand mode button breaks during normal usage. This means that I then had to hold the mixer in the lowered position for it to work. Things only got worse because while holding it in place the motor stops spinning. I will never buy a Hamilton Beach product again!!
customer_reviews.author: Sinclair P.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good mixer
customer_reviews.text: This is much more affordable than the Kitchen Aid and perfect for someone that only occasionally bakes. It may have been an operator error on my part but my only complaint is the beater didn't reach the very bottom of the bowl and I had to stir the flour by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Mercy Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Almost as good as that other famous brand that starts with a "K"
customer_reviews.text: Good for very light and medium weight mixes. Heavy thick sticky doughes put a strain on the machine causing mine to groan and vibrate more than I expected. The little engine that could got the job done but seemed to be straining a bit. No a huge deal, just something to be aware of. Good value for the money I paid. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Paul S. Rubinstein

customer_reviews.title: Mixer paddle attachment falls off.
customer_reviews.text: I used the stand mixer for the first time on July 04 , 2020. I had difficulty attaching the paddle to the main mixer. It took about ten times before the paddle stayed connected. The mixer worked well until I tilted the head of the mixer. The paddle promptly fell off. I attempted several times to reattach the paddle (getting cookie dough on my arm and fingers each time), to no avail. I finally set the paddle aside and finished mixing the dough by hand. After baking the cookies I washed the paddle and bowl, wiped off the mixer and put it back in its box to return. Frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce A. Jellen

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade!!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! The shield to prevent any splashing and wasting of precious product.
customer_reviews.author: Nonya

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: It's been a few weeks since I receive this cake mixer. My son and wife have been using it almost every day and they have no complaints. It is a good addition to my kitchen. It looks great. So thanks very much . Looking forward to using it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Sobers

customer_reviews.title: Price is awesome compared to KitchenAid
customer_reviews.text: I loved everything about it, and the suction cups on bottom is a great added feature. I have made cookies, cakes, and frosting, and mashed potatoes in me, and I am VERY happy with my Hamilton Beach stand mixer!!! So much better than the hand held I've been using for years! Thank you Hamilton Beach for making such stand mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer and at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I used the mixer to first make bread. The dough hook really works great and saved me from hand kneading. Then I mixed up a cake mix using the blender attachment which did a great job. It comes with the whisk too but just haven’t used it yet. The bowl locks in so it is secure and I only used the spatula once to scrape down some flour from the side. The attachment circle the bowl like the kitchen aid mixers how’re this unit cost a lot less.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Extremely great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is because the power cord is pretty short, and when I'm making some things have to push down on the top of it a tad to make sure it gets everything from the bottom. Other than that I think it's amazing. I really love it.
customer_reviews.author: Genie Dillinger

customer_reviews.title: Great Stand Up Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Answered prayer! Got this mixer at such a great "used" price. Box was used but the product was in perfect condition. Dough hook for kneading worked great. Couldn't leave mixer alone while the mixer was kneading dough, it moved around on the counter a bit...Oh well, no big deal.. because bread came out GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Janis Birney

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much perfect for my use and the price was great.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased with my Hamilton Beach mixer. Very lightweight and easy to handle. I just wish the slot into which you add the ingredients was a little larger and the bowl was a little bigger, but for my purposes it’s pretty much perfect. I’m so glad I didn’t spend the big bucks on a Kitchen Aid.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Prough

customer_reviews.title: Like it better than my Kitchenaid stand mixer!
customer_reviews.text: This mixer does just as good a job as my kitchenaid stand mixer at a fraction of the cost. I like it better because it’s lighter and has a handle which makes it much easier to move. Would make an excellent gift
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well when it works.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a few months seemingly. Motor seems to have broken, it will turn freely but on one spot of rotation makes a strange clicking sound, doesn't mix, likely something has broken inside and it's not easy to open up from tinkering around with it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Ling

customer_reviews.title: We bought it because the price and appearance were good.
customer_reviews.text: We bought it because the price and appearance was good, but it does not mix well at all times. The tilt button was suddenly broken in less than a year. It's useless now. Contacted Hamilton Beach days weeks ago and still haven't heard from them.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Item is bigger than I expected, which is good, but still very portable. Made shortbread cookies using cold butter and it mixed the dough very easily. Only negative feature is the splash shield. It was a bit tricky t to maneuver. You have to insert it on the bowl as you tilt the handle up a bit or it won't go on completely. The opening is not wide enough; however, there's too much open space. Did not keep flour from "dusting" everywhere even though I added it in small amounts. That might not be one of its purposes though. Overall I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great and for the price it does everything I need. I don’t bake all of the time so I don’t need anything fancier than this.
customer_reviews.author: Rrawlings

customer_reviews.title: Comes in its original box.
customer_reviews.text: The product came in its original box, and when it arrived at our house this morning my girlfriend totally saw one of her Christmas presents, I'm really bummed about that, so it's an early gift now. Aside from that everything is there and works great, she's really excited about it. Point of this review is make sure you always select gift wrapping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen Aid Who?
customer_reviews.text: It will slip on higher settings, but stay by it and ensure the suction cups are actually stabilizing it. I made the mistake of having my counter still slightly damp from wiping down before using it. Causing the "slip", other than that I love the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Texan Blossom

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool at great price!
customer_reviews.text: I am so impressed and glad I bought this instead of its higher competitors! You won’t be disappointed. It’s so easy my teens use it , yet high quality that it’s a bakers best friend!
customer_reviews.author: itmatters!

customer_reviews.title: Similar to kitchen aid
customer_reviews.text: I think I have been asking for a kitchen aid mixer for about 5 years now and I was gifted this mixer instead. Honestly it’s probably just as good as a kitchen aid mixer but it doesn’t have the capability to add external attachments. As long as you don’t mind the strange handle on the top, the mixer actually works great.
customer_reviews.author: shannon

customer_reviews.title: easy and fun to use.
customer_reviews.text: great mixer. am a man (75) starting to make homemade breads and such. this is a god send over the expensive kitchine aid. use it at least twice a week making breads and also cinnamon rolls. things turn out great with it.
customer_reviews.author: dwight johns

customer_reviews.title: Love my new mixer.
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted a stand mixer but could never afford it. This was on sale and so I bought it and I am so glad I did. I love it and it makes making cookies so much easier than doing it by hand
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Weak plastic construction... don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Plastic hinge broke after 4 uses. Top motor assembly too heavy for hinge. Also wobbly and doesn't lock in place easily. Can't recommend... i w so disgusted I put it in the trash. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Bendel

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice but functionality bad design. Has the power needed but the design of the mixer in relationship to the bowl is horrible. If I have to do it by hand then what’s the point.
customer_reviews.author: MYK

customer_reviews.title: Good mixer
customer_reviews.text: Good mixer, works well for me as a husband who is new to cooking (wife now disabled). A real pro cook might want a better, more expensive mixer but I don't why they would. This one works fine!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ricks

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed. I bought this to do my cookie dough, it doesn't blend very well and doesn't scrape the bottom or sides. Worst one I ever owned. If i had the box I'd send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Fink

customer_reviews.title: Mixer looks great but is difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: The hinge feature to tilt the head back is very difficult to put back in the operating mode. One of the three internal cords is fraying and some of the plastic parts have snapped off. I find this feature very unsatisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, BUT......
customer_reviews.text: This mixer gets the job done, but the splash guard makes it difficult to lower the head. Also the button used for tilting the head up or down often “sticks” in place.
customer_reviews.author: enuffgrace

customer_reviews.title: This baby makes good cookie dough.
customer_reviews.text: I don't cook, but the lady of this house does, and very well. If it is needed, I buy it. I am told it works very well. I do dishes, this item cleans up good.
customer_reviews.author: PC Scooter

customer_reviews.title: A great value for a great mixer. I love it :-)
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t be happier with this purchase! So excited to use during the upcoming holiday season. Also so glad that I didn’t spend four times as much when this one does everything that I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.author: MSJT73

customer_reviews.title: Capable and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: We use this primarily to mix and knead bread dough, and this unit handles that job perfectly. Whipping cream works great as well. The suction cups on the bottom really work to keep the mixer stable and keep it relatively quiet. We haven't had it long, but we have already put it through its paces, and it has done everything we need, very well.
customer_reviews.author: heartofsky

customer_reviews.title: Love the Hamilton Beach stand mixer!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Hamilton Beach mixer. I struggled with whether or not I should purchase a Kitchen Aid. I just didn’t know how much I would use it. I’m so glad I purchased the Hamilton Beach! Very easy to clean, to use, everything I needed and for such a great price. I would highly recommend this stand mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful mixer!
customer_reviews.text: I have had no trouble using this stand mixer. Great color and easy to use and clean. I used for 3 batches of Christmas cookies and the mixer worked great. Can't wait to see what else I can make with this mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Robin L. Merideth

customer_reviews.title: Breaks itself
customer_reviews.text: I'm not too sure why it came with a dough hook if it breaks it self trying to use the dough hook. I unbox it, and the first thing i try doing is kneading some pizza dough, after about a minute the dough hook stops moving, but I can hear the machine still running. I guess if you just want to use it for light stuff its okay, but I wouldn't know since I didn't get to try
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Great value with all the same features as my kitchen aid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: handy bakery machine
customer_reviews.text: due to the COVID-19, i gotta stay home. just way too bored at home. i decided to watch some Youtube videos and learn how to cook and bake lol. this machine is pretty good and easy to use. it comes with 1 pot 1 machine 3 adapters , the cord is a bit shorter than expected lol, overall the machine is pretty good
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice mixer and great value! Nice looking in the blue
customer_reviews.author: He_Read_She_Read

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach Electric Stand Mixer, Tilt-Head, 4 Quarts, 7 Speeds With Whisk, Dough Hook, Flat Beater Attachments, Splash Guard, Black (63391),
product_meta.description: Color:BlackThis Hamilton Beach stand mixer can tackle any baking recipe from whipping delicate meringues to mixing sticky pizza dough. It has the same rotating mixing action as KitchenAid stand mixers - which means complete bowl coverage with no scraping necessary. A tilt-up head lets you add ingredients and change attachments quickly.
feature_bullets: Same mixing action as KitchenAid stand mixers. This mixer performs better than 2-beater stand mixers, and features the popular tilt-up head design for adding ingredients and changing attachments quickly.
Baking with ease: Effortlessly mix thick batters and doughs like breads, pizza, cookies, mashed potatoes and more with a powerful, 300 watt motor.

Complete bowl coverage: No scraping necessary. Mix hands-free with excellent results every time. Planetary mixing rotates the beaters around the 4 quart, stainless steel bowl, for even and complete mixing.
Mixing versatility: includes splash guard, dough hook, whisk and flat beater. Wipe outside of stand mixer with a damp cloth or sponge and dry
7 speeds and mixing guide: Go from a slow stir to a fast mix, with exact control at each setting. A helpful guide at the mixer’s top lets you know which speed to use for various mixing methods.
KitchenAid is the registered trademark of Whirlpool properties use of the KitchenAid trademark does not imply any affiliation with or endorsement by KitchenAid or Whirlpool properties

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,696 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
